Novation.definition: the substitution by mutual agreement of one obligation for another with or without a change of parties and with the intent to extinguish the old obligation [no evidence that the contract was assigned
Novation.origin: [Late Latin novatio renewal, legal novation, from Latin novare to make new, from novus new]
